main event: A radar object was detected over Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, on April 1, 1961, at 1830 hours. The object was observed visually and on radar, and it exhibited irregular movements and high speed.
interesting points: The object was first seen moving slowly from east to south, then emitted a bluish-white light and moved at high speed to the west, out of sight.
The sighting lasted about one minute, and the object appeared metallic.
The visual sighting was confirmed by the radar station.
The report was forwarded for information, and it was noted that the object did not appear to be a normal aerial vehicle known to be in use.
The report mentions an earlier sighting of an object falling from a high altitude, leaving a trail of black smoke, which was thought to be a possible early failure of an attempted firing.
